text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with brussel sprouts with warm

like Brussels sprouts because they don't

probably had them horribly overcooked
which doesn't taste good at all
and with this recipe that's not gonna be
a problem because not only are these not
overcooked they're not even cooked so
check it out we're gonna start by
prepping about a pound of Brussels
sprouts and I know it's Brussels sprouts
but I say Brussels sprout to save time
regardless you're gonna take your
Brussels sprout you're gonna cut it in
half and then there's two ways you can
do this you can take your knife and make
two angled cuts to cut that core out at
the bottom and then slice them up and
that works fine but it gets a little
tricky there at the end so the
new-and-improved method I like is more
like this instead of cutting out that
core you just leave it there and you
slice your Brussels sprouts and when you
get down towards the core you just sort
of cut around it a couple cuts that way
a couple cuts that way and you're done
you just discard that it actually gives
you something to hold on to while you're
slicing and because we're not cooking
these I want you to cut them nice and
thin but one way or another I want you
to slice up about a pound of Brussels
sprouts and that is prepped so I'm gonna
toss that into a heat proof Bowl and
it's on to the warm bacon dressing so in
a saute pan over medium heat I have
about a tablespoon of vegetable oil and
I think like eight slices of bacon it's
probably four or five ounces they just
sliced up and I'm gonna cook that over
medium heat until pretty much crisp so
keep an eye on it and you can even turn
the heat down a little bit when it gets
closed so it doesn't overcook won't have
to be crispy but not too to dark brown
so that is looking very very enticing
right about there at that point we're
gonna add some brown sugar and stir that
in and basically a warm bacon dressing
it's kind of a sweet and sour type
affair so the brown sugars for the
sweets and for the sour we're gonna add
some cider vinegar and some freshly
squeezed lemon juice and by the way can
you do me a favor can you stop using
that little plastic lemon thing filled
with the reconstituted juice that's not
as good just buy some lemons alright so
some fresh
and then we're gonna turn the heat up to
high we want to bring that up to a boil
and while we're waiting for that to
happen we're gonna season that up with
some freshly ground black pepper and of
course a little shot of cayenne all
right so give that a stir and as soon as
that boils which is only gonna take like
a minute as soon as that boils you're
gonna pull it off the heat and you're
gonna pour it over your sliced brussel
sprouts and then quickly grab your tongs
and give it a mix and keep mixing until
it's thoroughly thoroughly combined
which is gonna take all of like 10

room temperature so it's basically a

they're coated with that amazing warm

might need a little salt all right

it makes for such an interesting side

are really delicious but I really like
